subject: Fix clearing of dns_domain and description on a network by setting to empty strings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-23 15:11:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/171f2676e60311892d1469514cff0dcc2ad3b856', 'message': "enable clearing of dns_domain on a network by setting to empty string

After setting a default dns_domain on a network

 openstack net set --dns-domain 'example.com.' <NETWORKID>

the setting could not be reverted back to an empty string using

 openstack net set --dns-domain '' <NETWORKID>

and the call also does not emit any error.

Reason was using the parsed argument directly as a condition instead of
comparing against None -- dropping the empty string as valid value.

Change-Id: Ia7b9738205002b028c19e4f397411c86469cba1a
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2023-11-23 15:43:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/a6788be315c847eaf22163d2645897d6a066949e', 'message': "Fix clearing of dns_domain on a network by setting to empty string

After setting a default dns_domain on a network

 openstack net set --dns-domain 'example.com.' <NETWORKID>

the setting could not be reverted back to an empty string using

 openstack net set --dns-domain '' <NETWORKID>

and the call also does not emit any error.

Reason was using the parsed argument directly as a condition instead of
comparing against None -- dropping the empty string as valid value.

Change-Id: Ia7b9738205002b028c19e4f397411c86469cba1a
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2023-11-24 11:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/network/v2/network.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_network.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/ce0765facba9c25fcc1fca662d23cc9c28345559', 'message': "Fix clearing of dns_domain and description on a network by setting to empty strings

After setting a default dns_domain on a network

 openstack net set --dns-domain 'example.com.' <NETWORKID>

the setting could not be reverted back to an empty string using

 openstack net set --dns-domain '' <NETWORKID>

and the call also does not emit any error.

The same is true for the description of a network.

Reason was using the parsed argument directly as a condition instead of
comparing against None -- dropping the empty string as valid value.

The name parameter already accepted an empty string.

This change also adds a testcase for dns_domain, description and the
network name parameter, checking if the empty string is forwarded.

Change-Id: Ia7b9738205002b028c19e4f397411c86469cba1a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix clearing of dns_domain and description on a network by setting to empty strings

After setting a default dns_domain on a network

 openstack net set --dns-domain 'example.com.' <NETWORKID>

the setting could not be reverted back to an empty string using

 openstack net set --dns-domain '' <NETWORKID>

and the call also does not emit any error.

The same is true for the description of a network.

Reason was using the parsed argument directly as a condition instead of
comparing against None -- dropping the empty string as valid value.

The name parameter already accepted an empty string.

This change also adds a testcase for dns_domain, description and the
network name parameter, checking if the empty string is forwarded.

Change-Id: Ia7b9738205002b028c19e4f397411c86469cba1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/65/901765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if parsed_args.dns_domain is not None:

commit_message:
[spec] Add Cross-AZ scheduling blueprint

Implements: blueprint cross-az-instance-scheduling
Change-Id: Ie8862c74d4e186271f14362c8acc22fd0e4a18e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/96/900296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Cross Availability Zone instance scheduling =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/cross-az-instance-scheduling This blueprint aims to provide an easy way for users to spawn a group of instances in different Availability Zones. Problem description =================== Right now in order to make a group of instances to be scheduled into multiple Availability Zones, user must know the list of present Availability Zones in the cloud and supply it the AZ explicitly to each instance independently while spawning it. This basically offloads implementation of instance scheduling across AZs to internal tooling, where each user will have their own way to separate instances across Availability Zones. Another issue is that available capacity in each AZ is unknown for end users, thus some instances might fail to spawn in more loaded AZs due to lack of capacity, while other AZs might have plenty of capacity and be ready to accept requested resource claims. Use Cases --------- Availability Zones mostly perceived as a physically isolated set of hardware, like placed in different fire rooms or even different datacenter within relatively small range. With that scenario in mind, users might want to additionally protect their data and/or clusters availability by spreading resources across Availability Zones and avoid having the single point of failure. This potentially provides higher resilience and reduces risk of outages of clusters spawned inside OpenStack. Good example of that use-case might be a database cluster, where each member of the cluster should reside in a different Availability Zone. Proposed change =============== Extending list of supported instance group policies with ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` might be the simplest and most efficient solution to the described use case". Which will allow the user to define a server group for their instances that should be spawned in different Availability Zones, while not hard failing if that request is impossible to fulfill (ie amount of instances in the group is higher then amount of AZs for the provider or some AZ is lacking capacity). When ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` is set, scheduler will fetch a list of Availability Zones and attempt to place instances into separate AZs. If amount of available for scheduling AZs is less than amount of instances in the group, AZ with fewest instances from the group should be selected. With that the user should be able to define maximum amount of instances within the group that can reside in the same AZ when cross-AZ scheduling is not possible with a ``max_server_per_host`` parameter. Alternatives ------------ * Keep things as is, but suggest that users avoid defining ``default_schedule_zone`` in ``nova.conf``. While this may result in instances being placed on different AZs, it is not guaranteed. Additionally, this approach assumes that the price and capacity of all Availability Zones is the same, while operators may prefer to have a default AZ and only use other AZs when needed. * Document recommended approach on automation of such scheduling on client-side This would require to come up with a way for quite some toolings, like Heat, Ansible, OpenTofu, SDK/CLI, etc. Such implementation will quite differ between toolings due to specifics of how they operate, not saying about higher efforts to maintain the documentation in the long run. * Allow to easily migrate instances between AZs, but that may be tricky to support for some scenarios, like when when ``cross_az_attach`` is set to False and storage is not shared across AZs. Data model impact ----------------- None is anticipated REST API impact --------------- The ``os-server-groups`` API will be extended in a following way: * Add ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` as a possible value for ``policy`` parameter. At the same time ``policies`` parameter is not going to be extended, since it is only available until the 2.63 microversion. * ``max_server_per_host`` will still be respected for ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` policy, meaning maximum amount of server per Availability Zone rather then host Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None is anticipated Other end user impact --------------------- * ``python-novaclient`` and OpenStackSDK should be updated to support the new ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` policy for server groups. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- * Developers of other projects might want to consider adding support of the new ``az-soft-anti-affinity`` server group policy. Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: None Other contributors: noonedeadpunk Feature Liaison --------------- Work Items ---------- TBD Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Testing of the new policy can be done only as a unit test, since as of today there are no multi-AZ grenade job. So feature should be tested in the same way as the rest of the AZ functionality. Documentation Impact ==================== No significat documentation changes are expected. Generated API reference along with the release note for the feature should be enough for the proposed implementation. References ========== * 2024.1 (Caracal) vPTG results ML: https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/P3RVZPP6MIGHKM4UL7CHIV42PSVBWTYS/ History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - 2024.1 Caracal - Introduced

commit_message:
Add availability zone-aware affinity filter to the scheduler

This spec proposes implementing of new scheduler filters to address a problem when it is not possible to enforce VMs creation in different availability groups.
Blueprints that address this problem exist but seem to be abandoned.
Blueprint: availability-zone-affinity-filters

Change-Id: I4a5d1b0d2f08fa7d02a4a00181a9886f09c6a6e9
Signed-off-by: viktorkrivak <viktor.krivak@ultimum.io>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/79/890779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Add availability zone-aware affinity filter to the scheduler ====================================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/availability-zone-affinity-filters Implementation of the availability zone aware scheduler filter so VMs can be placed to the same/different zones. Problem description =================== When the user wants to place VM in a different zone on multi availability zone openstack installation the only possibility is to manually select the availability zone for each VM. This is hard to automate because users need to know names of all availability zones and be aware if there is enough resources available in the selected zone. Another issue could occur during planned maintenance when VMs with specific availability zones cannot be simply migrated away to another AZ because an administrator don't know the exact reason of the placement decision of the user. Moreover, this filter could be used in Octavia to create load-balancer with members across multiple availability zones to provide a redundancy against failure of one availability zone (which is a common request). Use Cases --------- * End user wants to create high availability cluster application where each backend is placed in a different availability zone. * End user wants to create a cluster application which is sensitive to network latency, thus should be placed in the same datacenter (i.e. availability zone) without preference in which one. * Octavia load-balancers that are hosted across different availability zones for high availability. Proposed change =============== Bump instance_group object RPC version and add a new lazy-loaded field "availability_zones" with type DictOfListOfStringsField and creating corresponding load method get_availability_zones which will gather availability zones across all cells for instance group members and return a dict where the key is the name of the availability zone and its value is a list of all non-deleted instance group members in that zone. Two new scheduler filters will be added: * ServerGroupAzAntiAffinityFilter - Force VMs in the group to be placed in different availability zones. Optionally can have rule "max_server_per_zone" which will allow that many VMs in the same zone. If not set, the max_server_per_zone is considered to be 1. * ServerGroupAzAffinityFilter - Force VMs in the group to be placed in the same availability zone as other already created VMs. In case this is the first VM in the group filter returns True. Challenges ---------- Availability zone checks need to be also implemented in nova-compute to cover race condition when VMs are scheduled in parallel. This could be easily achieved by using the same mechanism as existing affinity filters. Do the validation in nova-compute after resources are claimed but before VMs build starts. The availability zones field in instance_group needs to be reset after certain operations. This could be achieved by extending the reset call that is already present for affinity filters for the hosts field. Alternatives ------------ * Merge this functionality into already existing affinity scheduler filters, however, it would also mean changing the API. The standalone filter is a much cleaner solution and allows the deployer to decide whether this feature is wanted or not. * End user could specify the availability zone explicitly but this will make automation harder and also won't cover cases where the end user doesn't care which zone will be used (even some zones could be unsuitable for scheduling). Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- * /os-server-groups (POST) Request body key "policy" could have additional values "az-affinity" and "az-anti-affinity" * /os-server-groups (GET) Response body key "policy" could have additional values "az-affinity" and "az-anti-affinity" * /os-server-groups/{server_group_id} (GET) Response body key "policy" could have additional values "az-affinity" and "az-anti-affinity" Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- OpenStack clients that have strict verification for policy names on the client side needs to add a new policy to allow new values. Performance Impact ------------------ New scheduler filters will gather availability zones via object but the object will cache the value so the performance impact of the scheduler for each host is negligible. However, loading of availability zones for the first time depends on the number of cells since each cell needs to be queried individually. This impact should be also negligible because the number of cells is usually rather low. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- Nova-conductorneeds to be always at least the same version as compute because of bumping the RPC version of the instance_group object. However, this is accomplished using standard upgrade procedures. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: viktor-krivak Feature Liaison --------------- Liaison Needed Work Items ---------- * Implement field availability_zone and corresponding load method in instance_group object and add resets * Implement scheduler filter * Implement parallel race condition fix and extend utils which validate policy against configured filters * Add unit and functional test * Update documentation (API reference) Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit and functional tests will be added. Documentation Impact ==================== API references need to be updated to include new policies. Configuration documentation needs to be upgraded to include new scheduler filters. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Finish processing the Database table as soon as possible

When connecting or reconnecting to the ovsdb database, if there
is an exception in processing the database (for example, an
exception in operating the database), it may cause the problem
that the data cannot be monitored correctly. see more [1]
This patch returns as soon as possible when processing the
Database table to avoid exceptions.

Partial-bug: #1988039

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ovsdbapp/+bug/1988039

Change-Id: I63bc80bc790d2caba44287b64be3e0d8722d8f6c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/10/857010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Finish processing the database table as soon as possible # see more: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ovsdbapp/+bug/1988039 if row._table.name == 'Database': return

commit_message:
Get rid of unused periodic_task

Currently Barbican is not using the periodic_task framework implemented
in oslo_service but implements its own mechanism based on the lower-
level thread group.

Change-Id: Idc69d61e07826923f3227aad6249252c3f739362

commit_message:
Remove unused wsgi/ssl options from oslo.service

Barbican does not provide wsgi server based on oslo.service library,
thus these options are not used.

Change-Id: I74c67b61796bcc7e5418144b10134e6171b1777f

commit_message:
Switch the multinode job to jammy

Ubuntu focal was in testing runtime as best effort
testing in 2023.1 cycle. In 2023.2, we do not need to
test the focal as such. Removing its testing to more
focus on making Jammy testing more stable.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/884952

Change-Id: I314b226df4ff70115fefffb1ee9f660ae113e8f8

commit_message:
[cinder] Transition Ussuri to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: If180f3d314c3b20611d13fcfe2cac8b78d7e32c5

commit_message:
[cinder] Transition Train to End of Life

With the new resolution '2023-07-24 Unmaintained status replaces
Extended Maintenance' [1] the last 3 EM branches (Xena, Wallaby,
Victoria) will transition to Unmaintained, but older branches (Ussuri,
Train) should move to End of Life unless someone steps up as maintainer
of this branch for this project.

To signal this, please add a -1 for this patch if you or the team want
to keep this branch open for further maintenance.
If there is no response from anyone within a reasonable time frame,
then PTLs/release liaisons will be asked to confirm the EOL transition
with their +1.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html

Change-Id: Ieb7cb5cea31990b363ab1aa584dddca43f38ab77

commit_message:
Use Namespaces when that's all we need

There's some places that we historically instantiated a ShardRange
merely to represent a range of the namespace tht isn't actually a
shard. All we need of the ShardRange is an encapsulation of a lower
and upper bound. Since the Namespace class now gives us that simpler
encapsulation, use it where we can.

Change-Id: I76f641c6664eb79e58d6fbe3ef0e94edafbed599

commit_message:
Fix --use-prefix-delegation subnet create argument

The --use-prefix-delegation argument when creating a
subnet should not take an argument of True/False, it
should simply trigger the code to set subnetpool_id
value to 'prefix_delegation'. Change action to correct
this.

Added unit test to cover missing checks.

Related-bug: #2028159
Change-Id: Ib7ee80100327b8611d4a354c7f4eb0e696c953da

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-09-06 14:51:03.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_rabbitmq_server_relations.py', 'unit_tests/test_rabbit_utils.py', 'files/collect_rabbitmq_stats.sh', 'hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py', 'hooks/rabbit_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server/commit/555942f89d2845bbbabfe87ea3717a0d7dbd2ff4', 'message': 'Allow NRPE to collect stats in CIS hardened env

It removes the necessity to run the cron task as root user
and ensure the content created in /var/lib/rabbitmq belongs

Closes-Bug: #1879524
Change-Id: I19e3d675ace7c669451ca40a20d21cef1aec6a95

commit_message:
Allow NRPE to collect stats in CIS hardened env

It removes the necessity to run the cron task as root user
and ensure the content created in /var/lib/rabbitmq belongs
to rabbitmq user and group solely.

Then giving access for nrpe user is done by adding its user
to rabbitmq group.
Also implemented in the upgrade-charm hook for ongoing
deployments

Closes-Bug: #1879524
Change-Id: I19e3d675ace7c669451ca40a20d21cef1aec6a95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-rabbitmq-server refs/changes/31/893931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NRPE_USER = 'nagios'CRONJOB_CMD = ("{schedule} rabbitmq timeout -k 10s -s SIGINT {timeout} "def add_nrpe_file_access(): """ Add Nagios user the access to rabbitmq directories It allows Nagios NRPE agent to collect the stats from rabbitmq """ run_cmd(['usermod', '-a', '-G', 'rabbitmq', NRPE_USER]) def fix_nrpe_file_owner(): """ Set rabbitmq as owner of logs data generated from cron job Necessary on older deployments where the cron task would create files with root as owner previously It ensures the compatibility with existing deployments """ # Although this should run only when related to nrpe subordinate # there is still a possibility for a race condition if upgrading the units # before the cron task had the time to create the files if os.path.exists(f'{LIB_PATH}data') and os.path.exists(f'{LIB_PATH}logs'): run_cmd(['chown', '-R', f'{RABBIT_USER}:{RABBIT_USER}', f'{LIB_PATH}data/', ]) run_cmd(['chown', '-R', f'{RABBIT_USER}:{RABBIT_USER}', f'{LIB_PATH}logs/', ]) run_cmd(['chmod', '750', f'{LIB_PATH}data/', f'{LIB_PATH}logs/', ])

commit_message:
Caracal-2 release for oslo.limit

This is the Caracal-2 milestone release for oslo.limit.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If the team is happy with the current release hash, please +1 this
patch and we will process the release. If you need to get some
important changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with
a new commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be
processed after January 11th.

Change-Id: Ic63ac2cb7d6599809f70609ec874a865481483aa
Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

commit_message:
Enable the Fluentd Plugin Systemd

Adds configurations and changes tasks to enable the
systemd plugin. Additionaly, the plugin is set to
read logs from the /var/log/journal directory

Implements: enable-fluent-plugin-systemd
Signed-off-by: Juan Pablo Suazo <jsuazo@whitestack.com>
Change-Id: Ic714a341befa5f906d9c0f78fa86f4c934df87cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/83/875983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <source> @type systemd tag journal path /var/log/journal <entry> fields_strip_underscores true fields_lowercase true </entry> </source>

commit_message:
Adding uplink_status_propagation option

Add charm option uplink-status-propagation, which for releases >= stein
will add the ml2 plugin uplink_status_propagation, that enabled ports to
have the propagate_uplink_status attribute to allow instance VF to see the PF
link state change for SR-IOV ports.

Change-Id: I4f1ace630c74363057b0bbdbc759c482125ad015
Partial-Bug: 1949491
(cherry picked from commit 3e387d591869b714be1c323f240fcaff289b3c10)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/43/902343/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uplink-status-propagation: type: boolean default: False description: | If True, on Stein or later attribute 'propagate_uplink_status' will be available to port. This attribute can be implemented for VF port to indicate if the VF link state should follow the state of the PF.

commit_message:
Adding uplink_status_propagation option

Add charm option uplink-status-propagation, which for releases >= stein
will add the ml2 plugin uplink_status_propagation, that enabled ports to
have the propagate_uplink_status attribute to allow instance VF to see the PF
link state change for SR-IOV ports.

Change-Id: I4f1ace630c74363057b0bbdbc759c482125ad015
Partial-Bug: 1949491
(cherry picked from commit 6f303256517588d9e1ac530150d419c7f8573fd8)

added_lines: uplink-status-propagation: type: boolean default: False description: | If True, on Stein or later attribute 'propagate_uplink_status' will be available to port. This attribute can be implemented for VF port to indicate if the VF link state should follow the state of the PF.

subject: Fix broken v4 caching due to leader-get asymmetry
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-23 23:36:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-vault/commit/913e650d9738cced8a98a547d28e3fdfb3511645', 'message': "Fix broken v4 caching due to leader-get asymmetry

leader-get decodes using json, but leader-set just sets the keys. This
wasn't taken into consideration when fetching all the keys to filter for
cached keys when a relation is leaving.  This is resolved in this patch.

commit_message:
Fix broken v4 caching due to leader-get asymmetry

leader-get decodes using json, but leader-set just sets the keys. This
wasn't taken into consideration when fetching all the keys to filter for
cached keys when a relation is leaving.  This is resolved in this patch.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1153

Change-Id: I2d44ec0c43c1ecffd9ac77a1162ead4e4a01aabe
(cherry picked from commit d925ac756638ed043e33a7b47a2681dfcd8900ce)
(cherry picked from commit 0a18ac23ce295c14789e99f7802efc51438d10aa)

added_lines: @patch.object(vault_pki.hookenv, 'leader_get') def test_certcache__fetch_none(self, mock_leader_get): request = self._default_request() # due to weird asymetry between leader_get and leader_set, if no # attribute is passed to leader_get() then the result is the # deserialised set of key, values as a dictionary. leader_get = { 'a': 'an-a', 'b': 'an-b', } mock_leader_get.return_value = leader_get self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._fetch(None), leader_get) mock_leader_get.assert_called_once_with(None)

commit_message:
Implement cert cache for vault units (v4)

This cache is used to store certificates and keys
issued by the leader unit. Non-leader units read
these certificates and keep data in their
"tls-certificates" relations up to date.
This ensures that charm units that receive certs
from vault can read from relation data of any
vault unit and receive correct data.

This patch is mostly the same as
I18aa6c9193379ea454851b6f60a8f331ef88a980
but improved to avoid LP#1896542 by removing
the section where a certificate can be reused
from cache during create_certs.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Barbieri <rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Kavanagh <alex.kavanagh@canonical.com>

['DEADBEEF', '1234567890']) def test_certcache__init(self): item = vault_pki.CertCache('a-request') self.assertEqual(item._request, 'a-request') class ReadOnlyDict(collections.OrderedDict): """The ReadOnly dictionary accessible via attributes.""" def __init__(self, data): for k, v in data.items(): super().__setitem__(k, v) def __getitem__(self, key): return super().__getitem__(key) def __setattr__(self, *_): raise TypeError("{} does not allow setting of attributes" .format(self.__class__.__name__)) def __setitem__(self, *_): raise TypeError("{} does not allow setting of items" .format(self.__class__.__name__)) __getattr__ = __getitem__ def _default_request(self): return self.ReadOnlyDict({ 'unit_name': 'the-name', '_is_top_level_server_cert': False, '_publish_key': "subbed", 'common_name': 'cn1' }) def test_certcache__cache_key_for(self): request = self.ReadOnlyDict({ 'unit_name': 'the-name', '_is_top_level_server_cert': True, '_publish_key': None, 'common_name': 'cn1' }) self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._cache_key_for('cert'), "pki:the-name:top_level_publish_key:cn1:cert") self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._cache_key_for('key'), "pki:the-name:top_level_publish_key:cn1:key") request = self._default_request() self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._cache_key_for('cert'), "pki:the-name:subbed:cn1:cert") self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._cache_key_for('key'), "pki:the-name:subbed:cn1:key") with self.assertRaises(AssertionError): vault_pki.CertCache(request)._cache_key_for('thing') @patch.object(vault_pki.hookenv, 'leader_get') def test_certcache__fetch(self, mock_leader_get): mock_leader_get.return_value = None request = self._default_request() self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._fetch("mine"), "") mock_leader_get.assert_called_once_with('mine') mock_leader_get.reset_mock() mock_leader_get.return_value = '"the-value"' self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request)._fetch("mine"), 'the-value') @patch.object(vault_pki.hookenv, 'leader_set') def test_certcache__store(self, mock_leader_set): request = self._default_request() vault_pki.CertCache(request)._store("mine", "a value") mock_leader_set.assert_called_once_with({"mine": '"a value"'}) # type error class A: pass with self.assertRaises(TypeError): vault_pki.CertCache(request)._store("mine", A()) # leader-set failure (subprocess call!) def _raise(*args, **kwargs): raise vault_pki.CalledProcessError(cmd="bang", returncode=1) mock_leader_set.side_effect = _raise with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): vault_pki.CertCache(request)._store("mine", "thing") @patch.object(vault_pki.hookenv, 'leader_set') def test_certcache__clear(self, mock_leader_set): request = self._default_request() vault_pki.CertCache(request)._clear("mine") mock_leader_set.assert_called_once_with({"mine": None}) # leader-set failure (subprocess call!) def _raise(*args, **kwargs): raise vault_pki.CalledProcessError(cmd="bang", returncode=1) mock_leader_set.side_effect = _raise with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): vault_pki.CertCache(request)._clear("mine") @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_clear') def test_certcache_clear(self, mock__clear): request = self._default_request() vault_pki.CertCache(request).clear() mock__clear.assert_has_calls([ call('pki:the-name:subbed:cn1:key'), call('pki:the-name:subbed:cn1:cert'), ]) # leader-set failure (subprocess call!) def _raise(*args, **kwargs): raise RuntimeError("bang") mock__clear.side_effect = _raise with self.assertRaises(RuntimeError): vault_pki.CertCache(request).clear() @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_store') @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_fetch') @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_cache_key_for') def test_certcache__key_property( self, mock__cache_key_for, mock__fetch, mock__store, ): request = self._default_request() mock__cache_key_for.return_value = "cache-key" mock__fetch.return_value = "the-value" # read self.assertEqual(vault_pki.CertCache(request).key, "the-value") mock__cache_key_for.assert_called_once_with('key') mock__fetch.assert_called_once_with('cache-key') # write vault_pki.CertCache(request).key = 'new-value' mock__store.assert_called_once_with('cache-key', 'new-value') @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_store') @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, '_fetch') @patch.object(vault_pki.CertCache, commit_message:
Add config option to override hardcoded service username

'manila' username is hardcoded and cannot be overridden. At
the moment the main purpose of this is to allow operator to
configure an username that can match manila charm's service
credential, which may be "manila", "manila_manilav2" or
"<prefix>-manila".

Related-bug: #2043588
Change-Id: I7bcdcd361b633481bd401209a1df614132d34139
(cherry picked from commit ed1b52eaf18e9ff1199a11b60b8dc82dbc88301d)

commit_message:
NVME-oF: Fix to support new "address" in sysfs

Attaching NVMe-oF no longer works in CentosOS 9 stream using nvme 2.4
and libnvme 1.4.

The reason is that the 'address' file in sysfs now has the 'src_addr'
information.

Before we had:
   traddr=127.0.0.1,trsvcid=4420 After:

Now we have:
   traddr=127.0.0.1,trsvcid=4420,src_addr=127.0.0.1

This patch fixes this issue and future proofs for any additional
information that may be added by parsing the contents and searching for
the parts we care: destination address and port.

Closes-Bug: #2035811
Change-Id: I7a33f38fb1b215dd23e2cff3ffa79025cf19def7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/94/895194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Parse and # only use destination addr and port ctrl_address = sysfs_property('address', ctrl_path) ctrl_address = dict((x.split('=') for x in ctrl_address.split(','))) ctrl_addr = ctrl_address['traddr'] ctrl_port = ctrl_address['trsvcid'] ctrl_portal = (ctrl_addr, ctrl_port, ctrl_transport, ctrl_hostnqn)
deleted_lines: (f'traddr={p.address},trsvcid={p.port}', p.transport, hostnqn) ctrl_addr = sysfs_property('address', ctrl_path) ctrl_portal = (ctrl_addr, ctrl_transport, ctrl_hostnqn)

commit_message:
Ignore group_policy extra spec in aggregate filter

currently usage of 'group_policy' extra spec together with
AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter effectively requires aggregates
with the same metadata set.

This patch tries to workaround this by explicitly ignoring
'group_policy' key in the AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter,
as it is the only defined non-namespaced and non-deprecated extra spec
existing in the code.

Partial-Bug: #2048874
Change-Id: I7eb7ad70faeaaf3ad86890fd8d44a8eec343ae39

commit_message:
Caracal-2 release for python-observabilityclient

This is the Caracal-2 milestone release for python-observabilityclient.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If the team is happy with the current release hash, please +1 this
patch and we will process the release. If you need to get some
important changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with
a new commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be
processed after January 11th.

Change-Id: Id6044775eb40f0b9159ef2ec488927e85593f976
Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

commit_message:
container-server: simplify GET methods

The container server GET method splits out to separate GET_* methods
for shard ranges/namespace or objects, but these then call to a shared
create_listing() method to construct the response. The
create_listing() method, and in turn the update_record() method, were
therefore parameterised to deal with shard ranges, namespaces or
objects.

This can be simplified by refactoring the GET_* methods to build their
own response bodies and then use a simpler shared method to create the
response. The shared method can also be used when building a HEAD
response.

This patch has no intentional behavioural changes.

Change-Id: I803c19905b4d20f90348cb503ca16dc531783b0c

commit_message:
Shorten snapshots names in CephFS drivers

The name set to snapshots in the CephFS drivers
is generated appending the snapshot id with the
snapshot instance id.

This is a problem because Ceph has a limitation
in the name of the subvolumes (shares) being created.

What happens then is, when trying to create a snapshot,
the snapshot gets created with a truncated name and it cannot
be accessed later.

This change drops the snapshot instance id from the
assigned name in order to avoid this limitation.

Closes-Bug: #1967760

Change-Id: Ifab3ec9de2abeb1af8e6499feca0236e1ee22fcf
(cherry picked from commit c86523d5909a2d61e03fb29f4c0c71b67cf18205)
(cherry picked from commit 4d4d4bdb118968b1cb089fa8b415c8354874e3a7)
(cherry picked from commit 3be5df4e1fe5feac43c3c1524eb00c4441eec476)

commit_message:
WIP: proxy: Use new namespace_list container API

Namespaces objects and smaller footprint shardrange objects. They are
also used in conjuction with the NamespaceBoundsList to be stored into
cache. A namespace stores the shard lower, upper and name, and is all
that is needed to make routing decisions in the proxy.

This patch is a rough first attempt to start using the new more
efficient namespace api.

Change-Id: I73b3bf09b2ed9314b3dfa751722ff67ac1f81f3c

If `includes` is given then the Namespace for that object name is requested, otherwise all namespaces are requested. :param account: account from which namespaces should be fetched. :param container: container from which namespaces should be fetched. :param includes: (optional) restricts the list of fetched namespaces :param states: (optional) the states of namespaces to be fetched. :return: a :class:`swift.common.utils.NamespaceBoundsList`, or None if there was a problem fetching the namespaces headers = {'X-Backend-Record-Type': 'namespace_list'} return self._parse_namespace_list(req, listing, response), response

commit_message:
Skip installing curl for EL

Due to the bug in Ansible [1] it does not resolve requirement of /usr/bin/curl
properly, always trying to install `curl-minimal`, which would fail on systems with
already installed `curl`.

Since `curl` presence is essential for DNF, we should be able to skip installation
of curl to EL systems, as they are all shipped with it as of today.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/82461

Closes-Bug: #2046172
Change-Id: I65d3fa2e3d6d38f0a51ce1f402ac25d976b67b89
(cherry picked from commit 60a1196fe69730d9c2aed51b72a8495464e6c5ed)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-08 09:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config/commit/ba37f85889a949b953c53c1085439c49028e3487', 'message': 'VLANs needs to be restarted when the associated linux bond is restarted

Consider the case where 2 interfaces eno1 and eno2 are added as members to
linux bond bond1. And vlan100 is created on bond1.  Now when os-net-config
is re-run it finds a change in ifcfg-eno1 or ifcfg-eno2. In this case the
affected devices would be restarted, which triggers a restart of bond1.
In this case the vlan devices associated with the bond shall also be

Change-Id: If80544262bf3827e5af0c32abcdcc5b6c2e71905
'}]
commit_message:
VLANs needs to be restarted when the associated linux bond is restarted

Consider the case where 2 interfaces eno1 and eno2 are added as members to
linux bond bond1. And vlan100 is created on bond1.  Now when os-net-config
is re-run it finds a change in ifcfg-eno1 or ifcfg-eno2. In this case the
affected devices would be restarted, which triggers a restart of bond1.
In this case the vlan devices associated with the bond shall also be
restarted.

Change-Id: If80544262bf3827e5af0c32abcdcc5b6c2e71905

commit_message:
Skip failure on setting inactive interface as bond's primary

The ovs command to set the primary interface of the bond fails
when the interface is not active. This patch ignores the error
and proceeds with the remaining configuration.

Change-Id: I3592af4f357dca483fc7914133e1fc248d12f11a

commit_message:
Make bandit voting on check and gate

Bandit 1.7.5 introduced some changes which broke the bandit job,
which caused the job to fail ages ago. We've since fixed those.

But, moving forward we need to fix these relatively quickly when
they occur, as such changing the test to voting improves our overall
security posture by forcing us to address these as they occur.

Change-Id: I4a7954bfd20eafdb578896e1f61204edc7f9ec7e

commit_message:
Ignore disabled routers for advertising

currently if a router is set to disabled the dragents still advertise
the routes. This causes the upstream routers to still know these routes
and try to forward packets to a non existing router.

By removing these routes we allow these upstream routers do directly
drop the traffic to these addresses instead of trying to forward it to
neutron routers.

Closes-Bug: 2018737

Change-Id: Icd6803769f37a04bf7581afb9722c78a44737374

commit_message:
Don't retry service update in report_state

The service_update DB API uses the oslo.db
retry logic with increasing retry interval
for each retry.

Due to the above if you for example block
the database connection the retry logic will
block the report for an extended period of
time that causes the service to be down even
if the service has recovered.

The retry logic is not optimal for the
functionality that report_state does where
we want it to fail fast and try report again.

Alternatives to this patch is duplicating the
service_update() DB API logic or remove the
wrapped retry on service_update completely but
that will also affect other parts of the code.

Closes-Bug: 2018595
Change-Id: I557d0eca5d8e85b15419591119758c635fb51666
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/904369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add validator for fixed_subnet

Validate the existance of the subnet referenced by fixed_subnet. It's
not checked if the subnet is associated to the fixed_network.

Closes-Bug: #2038109
Change-Id: Ia75f0ae525b768ad5b965d22b522cca6f80dcab2

commit_message:
devstack: Install vrf kernel module if needed

Depending on how the kernel was compiled vrf kernel module may not be
present on the box. This patch installs required packages that contain
vrf kernel module and installs the module as part of
`install_ovn_bgp_agent` function.

Change-Id: Ieb8351cf4eef6db7dc56fb21be9d0cedf6d2ffca
(cherry picked from commit 9e3a54805aad53a42ac61d6df8c1b803ccbb731a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent refs/changes/90/905090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function install_vrf_kernel_module_if_needed { # If the kernel vrf was compiled separately as a module if [ "$(grep CONFIG_NET_VRF /boot/config-$(uname -r) | cut -d = -f 2)" == "m" ]; then if is_ubuntu; then apt_get install linux-modules-extra-$(uname -r) fi if is_fedora; then sudo dnf install -y kernel-modules-core-$(uname -r) fi sudo modprobe vrf fi } install_vrf_kernel_module_if_needed

subject: Remove unnecessary `keys` calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-02 11:20:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/f59019da2c7d3c55a7b08bc9201c7e5736d973b1', 'message': "Remove unnecessary `keys` calls

Python >= 3.5 alternative: unpack into a list literal
Unpacking with * works with any object that is iterable and, since dictionaries return their keys when iterated through, you can easily create a list by using it within a list literal.

Adding .keys() i.e [*newdict.keys()] might help in making your intent a bit more explicit though it will cost you a function look-up and invocation. (which, in all honesty, isn't something you should really be worried about).
 Refer [PEP 448](https://peps.python.org/pep-0448/)

Change-Id: Iecaf73c9fd89257e32478c622407b0a3883b9e0d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary `keys` calls

Python >= 3.5 alternative: unpack into a list literal
Unpacking with * works with any object that is iterable and, since dictionaries return their keys when iterated through, you can easily create a list by using it within a list literal.

Adding .keys() i.e [*newdict.keys()] might help in making your intent a bit more explicit though it will cost you a function look-up and invocation. (which, in all honesty, isn't something you should really be worried about).
 Refer [PEP 448](https://peps.python.org/pep-0448/)

Change-Id: Iecaf73c9fd89257e32478c622407b0a3883b9e0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/88/904488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: expected_params = list(self._mapping) invalid_keys = set(query) - set(expected_params) known_keys = set(query).intersection(set(expected_params))
deleted_lines: expected_params = list(self._mapping.keys()) invalid_keys = set(query.keys()) - set(expected_params) known_keys = set(query.keys()).intersection( set(expected_params) )

commit_message:
Update stable jobs on master gate

As 2023.1 is released, we should add its job on master
gate to keep branchless tempest plugins compatible
to stable branch.

Also, removing the stable/xena job as that is in EM
state.
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/881254

Ref: Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

Change-Id: I39b5296ee68544a43182dcb346a040856d062aca

subject: CI: Ask ironic devstack to set node owner
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-08 17:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith/commit/b3a79fa0c3a9e26e9fa2f98dcc1994b55a7535e3', 'message': "CI: Ask ironic devstack to set node owner

The metalsmith CI job yaml documents contain a default OS_CLOUD,
which is fine, until Ironic sets the new Secure RBAC model to
enforcing by default. At which time, metalsmith jobs are not able
to see or modify nodes they previously could running as a project
scoped admin.

Executing the job as a project scoped admin is fine. The challenge
is the user's project needs to be granted access to see and use
the baremetal ndoe.

And so, to do this, we'll utilize a flag being added to ironic's
devstack script to trigger the node to be configured with an owner
which will allow metalsmith's requests to be serviced (in that the
baremetal node *will* be visible, and can be scheduled upon).

Change-Id: I5248894c824381f4a283b2746102df04962f20b0
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Ask ironic devstack to set node owner

The metalsmith CI job yaml documents contain a default OS_CLOUD,
which is fine, until Ironic sets the new Secure RBAC model to
enforcing by default. At which time, metalsmith jobs are not able
to see or modify nodes they previously could running as a project
scoped admin.

Executing the job as a project scoped admin is fine. The challenge
is the user's project needs to be granted access to see and use
the baremetal ndoe.

And so, to do this, we'll utilize a flag being added to ironic's
devstack script to trigger the node to be configured with an owner
which will allow metalsmith's requests to be serviced (in that the
baremetal node *will* be visible, and can be scheduled upon).

Change-Id: I5248894c824381f4a283b2746102df04962f20b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/12/905012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Tell devstack to set an owner project as metalsmith # testing is executed with a devstack-admin OS_CLOUD # which means all action use it, and with newer RBAC, # the node cannot be seen in that case. IRONIC_SET_NODE_OWNER: admin

commit_message:
inspector: Prepare to use ironic-inspector user by default

Currently even ironic-inspector services use the ironic keystone user
though the ironic-inspector keystone user is created. This adds
a warning message to make users aware of the future change to use
the own service user.

Change-Id: I62b7cf88496a811f4068244d7a3fb563a53aa1d6

subject: Fix Nova scp failures on Debian Bookworm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-09 18:21:40.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-2048700-98eb939b72079173.yaml', 'ansible/roles/nova-cell/templates/sshd_config.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/5aaac1a5a9fb090eaf1d8012cf233a5f13d3d4d7', 'message': 'Fix Nova scp failures on Debian Bookworm

The addition of an instance resize operation [1] to CI testing is
triggering a failure in kolla-ansible-debian-ovn jobs, which are using a
nodeset with multiple nodes:

    oslo_concurrency.processutils.ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
    Command: scp -r /var/lib/nova/instances/8ca2c7e8-acae-404c-af7d-6cac38e354b8_resize/disk 192.0.2.2:/var/lib/nova/instances/8ca2c7e8-acae-404c-af7d-6cac38e354b8/disk
    Exit code: 255
    Stdout: ''
    Stderr: "Warning: Permanently added '[192.0.2.2]:8022' (ED25519) to the list of known hosts.\r\nsubsystem request failed on channel 0\r\nscp: Connection closed\r\n"

This is not seen on Ubuntu Jammy, which uses OpenSSH 8.9, while Debian
Bookworm uses OpenSSH 9.2. This is likely related to this change in
OpenSSH 9.0 [2]:

    This release switches scp(1) from using the legacy scp/rcp protocol
    to using the SFTP protocol by default.

Configure sftp subsystem like on RHEL9 derivatives. Even though it is
not yet required for Ubuntu, we also configure it so we are ready for
the Noble release.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/904249
[2] https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-9.0

Closes-Bug: #2048700
Change-Id: I9f1129136d7664d5cc3b57ae5f7e8d05c499a2a5
(cherry picked from commit bfa9dd97a95479c2fa68887178d7e232d1a9a8c5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Nova scp failures on Debian Bookworm

The addition of an instance resize operation [1] to CI testing is
triggering a failure in kolla-ansible-debian-ovn jobs, which are using a
nodeset with multiple nodes:

    oslo_concurrency.processutils.ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
    Command: scp -r /var/lib/nova/instances/8ca2c7e8-acae-404c-af7d-6cac38e354b8_resize/disk 192.0.2.2:/var/lib/nova/instances/8ca2c7e8-acae-404c-af7d-6cac38e354b8/disk
    Exit code: 255
    Stdout: ''
    Stderr: "Warning: Permanently added '[192.0.2.2]:8022' (ED25519) to the list of known hosts.\r\nsubsystem request failed on channel 0\r\nscp: Connection closed\r\n"

This is not seen on Ubuntu Jammy, which uses OpenSSH 8.9, while Debian
Bookworm uses OpenSSH 9.2. This is likely related to this change in
OpenSSH 9.0 [2]:

    This release switches scp(1) from using the legacy scp/rcp protocol
    to using the SFTP protocol by default.

Configure sftp subsystem like on RHEL9 derivatives. Even though it is
not yet required for Ubuntu, we also configure it so we are ready for
the Noble release.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/904249
[2] https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-9.0

Closes-Bug: #2048700
Change-Id: I9f1129136d7664d5cc3b57ae5f7e8d05c499a2a5
(cherry picked from commit bfa9dd97a95479c2fa68887178d7e232d1a9a8c5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/84/905084/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% elif kolla_base_distro in ["debian", "ubuntu"] %} Subsystem sftp /usr/lib/openssh/sftp-server

commit_message:
Allows System to access VirtualMedia in Sushy

After DMTF release a new version of their guide[1], there was an
update in VirtualMedia URI.

Deprecated: /redfish/v1/Managers/{ManagerId}/VirtualMedia/{VirtualMediaId} New:
/redfish/v1/Systems/{ComputerSystemId}/VirtualMedia/{VirtualMediaId}

So, it is needed that System has access to VirtualMedia in Sushy lib
to later Ironic may be able to handle this. This way, i added a
property in System that it can have access to VirtualMedia instance.

[1]https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2046_2023.2.pdf

Partial-Bug: #2039458
Change-Id: I7bd7db539eab158c283524aecdaa9ebebd033cf6

commit_message:
Remove deprecated pbr options

The api_doc_dir option and the autodoc_index_modules option were both
deprecated in pbr 4.2.

The required options for the sphinxcontrib-apidoc extension are already
defined in doc/source/conf.py .

Change-Id: Ifcef9e84ff4febeb01cfdc75bdbd66565d0e8079

commit_message:
devstack: Install vrf kernel module if needed

Depending on how the kernel was compiled vrf kernel module may not be
present on the box. This patch installs required packages that contain
vrf kernel module and installs the module as part of
`install_ovn_bgp_agent` function.

Change-Id: Ieb8351cf4eef6db7dc56fb21be9d0cedf6d2ffca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent refs/changes/44/905144/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function install_vrf_kernel_module_if_needed { # If the kernel vrf was compiled separately as a module if [ "$(grep CONFIG_NET_VRF /boot/config-$(uname -r) | cut -d = -f 2)" == "m" ]; then if is_ubuntu; then apt_get install linux-modules-extra-$(uname -r) fi if is_fedora; then sudo dnf install -y kernel-modules-core-$(uname -r) fi sudo modprobe vrf fi } install_vrf_kernel_module_if_needed

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary egg_info options

The tag_svn_revision option was already removed[1]. The values set to
the other two options are effectively same as their defaults.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/619

commit_message:
Test python 3.11

As per the current release tested runtime, we
need to test python 3.8 to python 3.11 so using the
generic python testing template which run the python
versions jobs as per the current release runtime.

Also, updating the same in python classifier in setup.cfg

commit_message:
Retry setting rbd_stats_pools prometheus config

Setting the 'mgr/prometheus/rbd_stats_pools' option can fail
if we arrive too early, even if the cluster is bootstrapped. This is
particularly seen in ceph-radosgw test runs. This patchset thus
adds a retry decorator to work around this issue.

Change-Id: Id9b7b903e67154e7d2bb6fecbeef7fac126804a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/94/904594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @tenacity.retry( wait=tenacity.wait_exponential(multiplier=1, max=10), reraise=True, stop=tenacity.stop_after_attempt(30))

commit_message:
Bump Django version to Current LTS Version

This patch update Django version to the current LTS version i.e. 4.2
in global-requirements.txt as Django 3.2 is going to end its extended
support by April 2024[1]. horizon and all its plugins already support
Django 4.2 version, So let's make this the default version. Also,
I will update the Django version in ``upper-constraints.txt' in a
separate patch because if I update the Django version in
upper-constraints.txt in the same patch requirements check-uc job
starts failing.

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/download/

Change-Id: I0e0dfc3ef4fd0e6ff1064944aeb9128a607050e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/35/904135/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Django<4.3 # BSD

commit_message:
fix: SCALE_IN action not honoring specified node count

The SCALE_IN action in the lb_policy module was removing only
one node from the load balancer, regardless of the specified
count when the count was greater than 1. This was due to a
hard-coded count of 1 in the _get_delete_candidates function.

The root cause has been addressed by updating the
_get_delete_candidates function to dynamically handle the count
for SCALE_IN. The count is now retrieved from the action inputs,
and if not specified or invalid, it defaults to 1.

Closes-Bug: #2048099
Change-Id: I9ff12dec26f4c558ef5ef84de87668e9668cec80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/00/904800/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Addresses an issue related to the SCALE_IN action. The bug caused the removal of only one node from the load balancer even when the count of inputs was greater than 1.

Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I4f21b16ae3518b11b49e3c190b609c44c1e753d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/59/791859/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: description_file =author_email = openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org home_page = https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/heat-specs/

commit_message:
Do not try to bind port when we can't

Do not call context.set_binding when we do not have
devices that matches port switch and we can't handle
the port. Let other drivers like n-g-s process the port.

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-generic-switch/src/branch/master/networking_generic_switch/generic_switch_mech.py#L446

Change-Id: I3af25f7d230dd3576286ae63a5c70837d3c810a9
